title: Crown Prince opens Rajabhakti Park
text:
Crown Prince opens Rajabhakti Park 26 Sep 2015 at 20:51 4,766 viewed 1 comments 
Rajabhakti Park in Hua Hin district, Prachuap Khiri Khan province, is officially opened on Saturday in a ceremony presided over by His Royal Highness Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn. (Photo by Pattarapong Chatpattarasill) - + Rajabhakti Park HUA HIN â€” His Royal Highness Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn officially opened on Saturday Rajabhakti Park built to honour past Thai monarchs. 
The Prince and Her Royal Highness Princess Bajrakitiyabha presided over the ceremony to open the park in Hua Hin district, Prachuab Khiri Khan province. Photo gallery: Rajabhakti Park 
The new attraction has seven huge statues of Thai kings built to show Thai people's deep respect and loyalty to the royal institution. They are: King Ramkhamhaeng, King Naresuan, King Taksin, King Rama I, King Rama IV and King Rama V. All left behind great contributions to the kingdom. 
The 222-rai park is built in the compound of the Army Non-commissioned Officer School, about five kilometres south of the resort district town on Phetkasem Road.
